resources.description: graphical files of seasonal and diurnal data from surface weather stations
resources.name: graphical files of seasonal and diurnal data from surface weather stations

name: nrel-gis-data-seasonal-and-diurnal-data-from-afghanistan-surface-weather-stations-ef9a0
notes:
This dataset was developed by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) for the [U.S. Agency for International Development'](http://www.usaid.gov/)s (USAID) [South Asia Regional Initiative for Energy Cooperation](http://www.sari-energy.org) (SARI/E). The dataset contains graphical files of seasonal and diurnal data from over 50 surface weather stations in .pdf format in Afghanistan. The data were output in Geographic Information Systems (GIS) format and incorporated into a [Geospatial Toolkit](http://www.nrel.gov+geospatial_toolkits.html) (GsT). The GsT allows the user to examine the resource data in a geospatial context along with other key information relevant to renewable energy development, such as transportation networks, transmission corridors, existing power facilities, load centers, terrain conditions, and land use.

title: NREL GIS Data: Seasonal and diurnal data from Afghanistan surface weather stations
